EU authorities spent the money on strengthening border controls in order to interdict the flow of illicit trafficking in humans and narcotics. And at the same time they aim to liberalize viza regime between Ukraine and EU. It seems to me these measures disagree. It cannot be done for several reasons. First of all emigrants will flood to Europe from Chechnya. And it's common knowledge Chechen "refugees" dream of European market development, interloping weapons, narcotics and "direct labor". Moreover, it's clear that Chechen extremists' appearance in Europe necessitates the threat to our European security because of very possible terrorist actions. Poland, Slovakia, Czechia and Austria have already learned "Chechen factor" by own experience. And once more Brussels is going to open EU borders for them... Splendid!

post_info.post_title: What a joke! EU spared no $22 million to insulate itself from Ukraine

The more I hear of these ramblings, the more I get the feeling that the chechen cause is ours... There is no love for Russia in Europe and your actions in Chechnia are disgraceful, even for you....

Does anybody here know what Blonde is actually trying to say? He starts of with EU border control, then goes off to the EU's visa policies towards the Ukraine and then ends up with the Chechyans.
 
 VoR makes more sense than this. And that's saying something.
How does spending extra money on preventing illegal immigration while relaxing making legal immigration easier cause problems that are assiociated with illegal immigration?

Seems the guy thinks that since it has become easier for a ukrainian to get a visa for legal entry, this will make it easier for Chechens to get in illegally in spite of additional resources spent on preventing illegal immigration. He also adds that the illegal Chechen immigrants will spread crime/violence/terrorism.
 
 And no, his arguments do not hold up under stress any better than VoR's. And yes, this is saying something.
 
 It is ever a problem. Violence coupled with retaliation logic always results in these situations...
The thread starter is one of those (or, the) russian one-post-wonders who only post about how evil the Chechens are... Rather pointless really :p

Of course he is.
 
 Can we retaliate with how awful the russian mafia is? And then point out that the Albanian mafia is reportedly crueler? And eventually find out that ANY nation can produce brilliant people in all fields, including violence, torture and crime enforcement (sic).

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  What a joke! EU spared no $22 million to insulate itself from Ukraine
